# UCMJ Law
UCMJ and SOP applies to all GOVFOR and OPFOR personnel as well as those aboard a GOVFOR/OPFOR vessel or base.
## Basics
- Command and [color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] are required to both enforce the law and abide by it. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] and Command may, at their discretion, ignore Minor Crimes unless they are ordered to enforce one by a higher position. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] breaking the law in any capacity cannot be ignored.
Should [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color]s disagree on cases, GOVFOR/OPFOR Law rank structure must be followed.
- [color=#00CBFE][bold]High Command (Usually Faxed)[/bold][/color] > [color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] > Deputized [color=#ff000d][bold]MP/Law Enforcement[/bold][/color] > [color=#8B0000][bold]Faction Command[/bold][/color]
